pageContext.claim: “I fully support transparency on the so-called whistleblower information, even though it was supposedly second-hand information, which is sort of interesting.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. intelligence community inspector general released a statement Sept. 30 disclosing that the Ukraine whistleblower relied on both firsthand and secondhand information in drafting the complaint against Trump. The statement says: "The Complainant on the form he or she submitted on August 12, 2019 in fact checked two relevant boxes: The first box stated that, 'I have personal and/or direct knowledge of events or records involved'; and the second box stated that, 'Other employees have told me about events or records involved.'" Virtually all of the claims in the whistleblower's Aug. 12 complaint have been corroborated by other sources, including by Trump himself.
